I've noticed a discrepancy between the Mountain Bike page in CMS and on the live website.

In CMS, there's a 'Who' section on the right hand side of the page as below. However, this box is not present on the live website. Do you have any idea why this might be happening??

subject: Essential updates to php libraries on london2012.com

comments.value:
1. In order to prevent surplus httpd process, we propose specifying a much more reasonable php/curl timeout of ~30 seconds.

This involves amending the Kitsite Community library and also any templates that make use of it.
 Implementation and testing: 1   day
 Deployment and testing:     0.5 day

2. In order to disable community functionality altogether, we propose the addition of a frontend flag "$communityServerPlannedMaintenance=true.". While this flag is set, pages that require dynamic functionality (login/registration/search/event-submission/etc.) will redirect users to a holding page: "Sorry the website is undergoing planned maintenance between 10pm and 2am GMT. The following functionality is unavailable: search,login,etc".
 Implementation and testing: 1   day
 Deployment and testing:     0.5 day
Also will require some editorial resource in order to decide on wording.

Total: 3 days
Deployed, working and was used during the weekend's server-move.

subject: User photo uploads appearing in wrong section on photo page

comments.value:
Hi,

I've been looking at recent photos we have received from the general public. In reviewing these on CMS, some photos I've rejected but others have been approved.

When they are approved, they should appear at the bottom of this page in the blue box http://www.london2012.com/photos/index.php . However, for some reason approved photos have been appearing on the 'latest photos' section, becoming mixed in with our own photos - http://www.london2012.com/photos/search.php

I've taken down all the offending photos, but as this is obviously quite an important matter - coupled with the fact that we are likely to get more and more photos from the public as we move towards the Games - could someone please look into this and try to work out what is causing this problem? It's very important photos from the general public stay entirely separate from our own photos.

Thanks,

Michael

Is there any news on this?

Thanks,

Michael
Michael, it's on our list. If it's urgent, we might be able to fit it in today (but check with Liz first, we have a bit of a backlog), if not, it should be by tomorrow.
Ok thanks

Hello Michael,
I'm sorry it has taken so long for me to get to look at this.
Can you give me an example of a user-submitted photo that is (or was) appearing in the "Latest photos" please?
Kieran

Hi Kieran,

Unfortunately, as I had to delete the images to remove them entirely from the incorrect section on the Photo page, I’m not able to give you any examples.

Thanks

Do you remember the names? or any other details of the images?
If so, I should be able to retrieve them from the expired archive.
There was one of two kids at some sort of radio station – the word “Greenzone” rings a bell although I’m not exactly sure what it was....

http://new2012.kitsite.com/kit/files/picture/edit/images/user-uploads/approved/family-olympic-song-writingopen-weekend-image-upload.jpeg

Found it. It had been saved in the images section too

Thanks

Hi Michael,

Did you upload that image originally?
Or was it submitted by a frontend website user?

Kieran
I approved it, which to my knowledge just sent it to the User Photos section of the website. However, it seems doing so also added it to the main Images section.

That picture dates from June 2010, and was associated with an open weekend event.
Usually, open weekend-uploaded photos (in fact, /all/ user-uploaded photos) should have an "ownerName" attribute (which we then use to exclude them from the general image search). This photo does NOT have such a field. I can only presume that it was down to a temporary problem with the open weekend submission code which (I'm guessing) was fixed last year.
All recent user-submitted content /does/ have an "ownerName" attribute, meaning it doesn't appear in the general search results.
I think the only thing I can suggest is that if you see any recurrence of this issue, please notify us asap. Preferably before performing any remedial work yourself, as it will make it much easier for us to diagnose. (Obviously if it's an emergency I wouldn't expect you to contact me before remedying!).
I hope this is a satisfactory solution. Rest assured that any recurrence will be investigated and fixed immediately!

Kieran
investigation time = at least 0.2 but may not be billable?

Ok cool thanks. I’ll try and another one this afternoon and see how it goes.

Before I do so, could you possibly point out where I should be seeing this ownerName attribute?

Thanks

The ownerName attribute isn't actually displayed in the cms tools I'm afraid!
Kieran

Hi Michael,
I'm setting this to "pending" unless/until there's any recurrence.
Kieran

Hi,

Thanks

Hi Michael/Liz,
This isn't something which would be terribly trivial to implement (mainly because it's the /page/ that is owned by the user, but only the /image/ that appears in the CMS search results).
My guess is that it would take a day of work to get it working.
(this involves developing/testing on dev, then migrating to live env. and testing).
Please let us know if you would like to proceed with this.
Kieran
Hm. Could you not expose this in the ‘photo page’ section, then?

Hi Liz,
I'm not quite sure what you mean.
Could you perhaps send a screen shot of where you would (ideally) like it to
appear?
Thanks,
Kieran
I think the point is that it doesn’t really matter *where* it appears, so long as there is some way of checking. Is that right, Michael? What is your concern with the process as it currently stands?

Hi,

Yep, that’s pretty much the point. The only way of currently knowing where a photo is going to appear – and thus if it’s appropriate for us to publish at all – is when the photo has already reached the live site.

If we could get some kind of warning, or were able to proactively check for ourselves whether the content would be usable (i.e. not reach the main photo section too), this would make the process a lot easier and avoid any potential problems with user photos getting mixed in with our own ones.

It’s a time consuming process to have to check that user photos have not inadvertently made it through to the main photo section, and I suspect there might be some rights issues with accidentally claiming a photo from a member of the general public as our own.

Thanks

Hi,
Unless I'm missing something, there are two screens in the CMS: one for user-uploads ("Photo uploads") and one for other images ("Pictures").
All of the user-uploaded images should appear as such, once they're approved.
They should /not/ appear in the general images pages/searches.
As discussed above, I believe that the reported problem [whereby some user-uploaded images /were/ appearing in the general image searches] was a temporary one, dating from some work last year. However - again as I said - if the problem recurs then we I will immediately investigate.

In short, I think you already have such a warning - i.e. user-uploaded photos appear in the "Photo uploads" cms screen, and general/editorially-uploaded images appear in the "Pictures" screen in the cms.

I may (as ever!) be missing something though? Please let know.

Kind regards,

Kieran

Hi Kieran,

Yep, I’m referring to the user-uploaded photos appearing in the general image search on the London 2012 website. If we can be sure this was a temporary problem and is now resolved, there shouldn’t be any issues, but obviously we want to be entirely sure about this before we start accepting user-uploaded photos en masse

Thanks
Ok cool – let’s close this for now, then!

Hi Michael,
To the best of my knowledge, and as far as the evidence suggests. there has
not been a problem since last July. While it's impossible to be 100% sure, I
see no reason to suspect that there is currently a problem.
That sounds mealy-mouthed! What I mean is: it should be fine!
Kieran

Again, days = 0.2.
This one's probably more billable than the other one!

Ok that’s great, thanks very much

Michael

subject: Weird publishing bug

comments.value:
Hi Danny,

I’ve just spoken to Selina. As suspected, she wasn’t up publishing
things at 5am on Friday. The page only page she did anything with was
‘Expired Job "Production Manager - Capital Works (ref 545)"’

It wasn’t scheduled to expire – she logged in and expired it herself at 4.30pm.

I’ve asked her to reset her password.

Over to you...

Deborah

A bit of feedback on this:

Go to http://new2012.kitsite.com/kit/admin/users/selina.donald
Last logged in 1 Apr 2011, 05:07, except Selina has reported not logging in at 5am on Friday.

Recent activity:
Fri, 1 Apr Published Volunteering about hub "Other ways to volunteer"
Fri, 1 Apr Published Volunteering infopage "London Ambassadors"
Fri, 1 Apr Published Volunteering infopage "For Games Maker employers"
Fri, 1 Apr Published Volunteering infopage "Technology"
Fri, 1 Apr Published Volunteering infopage "Olympic and Paralympic Games Services"
Fri, 1 Apr Published Volunteering video "Kelly, Transport"
Fri, 1 Apr Published Volunteering about hub "Games Maker roles and venues"
Fri, 1 Apr Published Generic hub "Games-time opportunities"
Fri, 1 Apr Published Generic content "Contact us"
Fri, 1 Apr Published Generic hub "Get involved"
Fri, 1 Apr Published Generic hub "Games-time opportunities"
Fri, 1 Apr Published Generic content "FAQ about Games-time opportunities"
Fri, 1 Apr Published Generic hub "Jobs"
Fri, 1 Apr Published Jobs search "Search London 2012 Ceremonies jobs"
Fri, 1 Apr Expired Job "Production Manager - Capital Works (ref 545)"

I can't easily look at the history of "Production Manager - Capital Works (ref 545)", because it has expired.

A number of these pages were locked by Michael Thorne, e.g. get-involved/jobs/working-for-locog/index.php, and so should not have been published.

The questions that need answering are:
1. Did somebody actually log in as Selina at 5am on Friday or have we got our timing confused;
2. Were all the pages apparently published by Selina, published manually or automatically as part of a workflow;
3. If they were published automatically, can the workflow be amended so that only the appropriate pages are published and not if they are locked to somebody else?

Marking as high, because debs is very perplexed and would like to get to the bottom of what is going on, i.e. is this a bug or is Selina's account being misused in some way.

Deborah, some initial feedback on this one: the login time was displaying incorrectly. It was out by 12 hours and has now been amended to show the correct login time, which fits in with the likely time Selina did actually login. The publication activity is likely to be due to automated workflow rules, possibly triggered by the publication of the original page, however locked pages should not have been republished. this is likely to be a bug.

Still to do:
- review the workflow actually in place, to understand why the other pages were published. 
- identify what is causing locked pages to be published.
- amend as necessary.

We are treating this as high priority, but it may be a few days before we can look at it again.

At 17:07 on Friday, Selina published the following sections:

 get-involved
 get-involved/jobs
 get-involved/jobs/jobs-at-london-2012-ceremonies
 
This led to all pages in those sections being published. Including any which were in-progress.
It does NOT publish any pages that are checked-out to other people.

Michael did save get-involved/jobs/index.php at 11:51 on Friday. Unless you explicitly "lock" a page (in the CMS folder-view) the page will not be "checked-out" to you.
The page was sitting "In progress", not checked out to anyone, and so was published when the section was published.

I hope this clears up the mystery?

Kieran
But why should publishing a job in the ceremonies section lead to everything else being published? Can that be stopped?
Selina (as far as I can gather from the logs) clicked on those three /sections/ and then clicked "publish". This published everything in that section.
Pls see my later email on this point. You’re right, she did publish them all – but does she need to? And why did publishing the ‘get involved’ index publish ‘in progress’ pages within that?

To clarify, she did not publish the ‘get involved’ index.
She published the 'get involved' /section/ (*)
i.e. she selected the /section/ in the cms, and clicked on the "publish" icon.
Publishing a section means "publish everything in this section (unless it's checked out to anyone)".

(*) At least, this is what I /believe/ she did, having examined the logs from this period).
Danny, have set days to 0.2 although I suspect this mightn't be billable.

subject: Welsh pages on OTR website

comments.value:
Hi,

I'm trying to define naming conventions for the pages of the torch relay website and Welsh is proving a bit tricky.  The Welsh landing page is fine as we'll just give it a different name (Cyfnewid y Fflam Olympiadd apparently), but some of the place names are the same in Welsh and English (e.g. Bangor).  So, my question, could we put the Welsh pages in a sub directory so that they can have the same name if required.

For example, have the English Bangor page here:
london2012.com/games/olympic-torch-relay/olympic-torch-relay-route/bangor

And the Welsh one here:
london2012.com/games/olympic-torch-relay/olympic-torch-relay-route/cy/bangor

Would this break the navigation for example?

Deborah - fyi

Regards,
Andy

Andy Watkins
New Media Project Manager
New Media, Communications and Public Affairs
Direct line:  +44 (0)203 2012 736

London Organising Committee of the Olympic Games and Paralympic Games Ltd
One Churchill Place
Canary Wharf
London E14 5LN

Switchboard: +44 (0)203 2012 000
Fax: +44 (0)207 7191 308
london2012.comhttp://www.london2012.com/

P Please consider the environment before printing this email

Do the Welsh pages need to show up in the navigation? we could easily hide them from the nav (and with a bit of coding exclude them from the breadcrumb)

Maybe something has changed, but as I understood it these we're a set of standalone welsh pages and not equivalent pages (to their english counterparts).

Could you clarify?

No, they shouldn’t show up in the navigation, unless you’re viewing them of course.

There is a standalone Welsh page that sits alongside the English landing page but provides an overview of the entire process rather than equivalent info. However, celebration pages for locations in Wales do need a Welsh version.

Hope that helps,
Andy

We can have different filenames (* with a bit of manual intervention) for example bangor.php and bangor-cy.php we could then hide the bangor-cy.php page from the navigation.

So you'd have:

London (london.php)
Bangor (bangor.php)
Bangor (bangor-cy.php) **[ hidden from nav]**
Edinburgh (edinburgh.php)

The link in the left hand nav though would still link to the English version, but the section would stay correct and all the other locations would appear correctly.

The same should also work for the index page (basically we hide the welsh version).

The Breadcrumb should work as expected (as the current page isn't a link, only the name will show which in both cases will be Bangor)

This would be preferable to having to specially code the left hand navigation just for the OTR section (as we'd prefer to not have to duplicate the same common navigation code in two places and at the same time rather not have to add in lots of exceptions to a global component)

Hi Jamie, happy to take your lead on this. If we create -cy pages I assume the page title and H1 tag can be defined separately. (It seems that these are both driven by the page name in the CMS, unless I’ve misunderstood how it works.)

Thanks,
Andy

Absolutely, we have a special 'displayName' field which overrides the default page name that is used in the CMS when appearing in titles and H1 tags.

We'll need to assign the displayName's manually but can sort that out once the pages are created,
Great - looks like we have a plan!

Lars,

Not sure if you've dealt with Welsh Pages yet, is you have can probably close this, if not you may want to read on.
Andy, it might be a good idea to create a welsh page or two in order to make sure we can get it working in the way you want it to.
There's a field on every OTR page which takes an url. The link to the welsh page will only display if there's a link.

done

OK. We have a bit of a problem with Young Leaders.

Morag says it's not necessarily the young leaders that are doing the blog posts. Note also, that the teams need to be rationalized. See #3394. I think when they are, Aberdeen should also be visible (although Tower Hamlets 2 might not be).

I think it is also a bit harder for the teams to all work nicely on staging, because while we have the indexing switched off (which we now do), I imagine that no new posts will show up in the right team on staging. I don't think this is something we should attempt to address, because Young Leaders should nave have been left on staging in a half-finished state for so long (my fault, really--the work was sandwiched between other urgent pieces of work and it rather got ignored), but it may be confusing for Morag if she doesn't see new (or changed) posts showing up in the right place on staging.

I do suggest that Jamie has a quick chat with Morag to resolve what to do and he then gives Lars a clearer brief than he got from me. This was a more subtle piece of work than I realised. Sorry, Lars.

Morag

I will re-publish all this to staging now. 

Lars

If you need more time to complete the form than the 21 days mentioned in the covering letter or have other questions then please let me know.
Kind Regards,
Huw Williams

subject: Young Leaders - new templates

comments.value:
This is a rather late request for an amendment to the Young Leaders pages which is actually required rather soon. I'm really hoping this doesn't turn out to be too complex, as we need the pages to be editable within a couple of weeks.... My bad, as I have sat on these templates rather too long with being away and everything else I have been juggling.

It is basically a change to the section 'Meet the Young Leaders' http://www.london2012.com/young-leaders/meet to make it function more like a blog. 

So there will be 2 new templates:

1. Revised 'Meet the Young Leaders':  http://london2012.collectiveldn.com/young-leaders/meet/

This page is the generic Young Leaders updates page that shows the latest Young Leaders news and is not specific to any one particular Young Leaders team. Users would get to this page by clicking the Meet the Young Leaders link in the main navigation.

2. Revised team page: http://london2012.collectiveldn.com/young-leaders/meet/index2.html

This is a team specific page (one template that can be used to create individual pages for each team)

 
If you ignore the content and focus on the page templates you can see that they are different. The differences are:
- The generic news template has links to all individual teams in the top section of the page
- The team specific template has links to individual Young Leader pages in the top section of the page, and a link to go back to view all the teams

I have asked PJ at Collective to send through the html to you today - can we have a chat about it when you get it so we can get a sense of how long it will take to implement?

Thanks - and apologies for adding to your already-overflowing plate...

Morag
Marking as high.
Anyone has a zip file in there inbox they don't know what to do with?
Hello - is it possible to let me know your thoughts on this - and if you have any questions? Does end of next week for template handover look feasible? Thanks!
We are aiming to get this done by the end of this week. We are unlikely to be ready to handover before Friday. Estimated time: up to 2 days.

Hi Danny

Can we do our best for end of Friday on this? Internal client needs to be able to input content next week.

Thank you

subject: Orange Olympic logo on all Ticketing pages in london2012.com

comments.value:
Please can you ensure that only the orange Olympic logo appears on all the Ticketing pages i.e. this page and subpages http://www.london2012.com/visiting/tickets/index.php

We are only selling Olympic tickets so want to avoid the Para logo appearing - plus orange is our Ticketing colour.

Thanks!

Morag Reavley
New Media Manager
London Organising Committee of the Olympic Games and Paralympic Games
1 Churchill Place
Canary Wharf
London
Direct dial: 020 32012 160
Reception: 020 32012 000
High
Are you able to have a look at this today please? Sorry - am being chased...
Oh Morag, i did this but forgot the update the ticket. Just double-checked it and its live!

Thanks, Lars.

Just checked though – all the sub-pages in this section should also have orange logos but e.g. http://www.london2012.com/visiting/tickets/videos/index.php still has a Para logo. Is it possible to enforce the ‘orange only’ rule throughout the Tickets section?

Thank you!
Sorry Morag, that was a misunderstanding, i purposely wrote it including the 50% para logo, will change asap.

No worries – we usually do alternate but just now it’s all about Olympic tickets and not Para tickets.

Thanks for updating.
Its all orange now!

Thank you, Lars.

Just noticed though that this page is still showing a Para logo: http://www.london2012.com/visiting/tickets/videos/index.php 
________________________________________
Oh i hadn't published them, sorry, did that now!
Thank you!!
